main.name: Eric Leong
main.bio: Hello~ I'm Eric. I'm currently an incoming Junior at UC Berkeley. I came into Berkeley intending to study Biology and pursue the pre-med route for medical school. However, out of interest, I decided to take a Computer Science class and I enjoyed the class so much that decided to study Computer Science instead. Despite aiming to work in the industry as a Software Engineer, I am currently contributing to research in Computational Biology as it allows me to study the intersection between Computer Science and Biology.
main.bio1: I am also fond of Full Stack Development as a result of prior experience with Web Development. I'm currently acting as a Web Committee Co-Director of the UC Berkeley IEEE chapter where I lead the committee through multiple projects to improve the website.  I also have experience with Full Stack Development as a Software Engineering Intern at a SkyDeck startup, CatalistX, where I developed a wide variety of smaller features in addition to a few bigger ones, such as a messenger feature.
main.bio2: This summer, I am working as a Software Engineering Intern at Symantec on the Norton Mobile Solutions team. I developed an automated performance testing pipeline that is usable by all the mobile apps. The pipeline is currently in use for comparing new product releases to previous ones and identifying any performance differences through analysis on collected performance data.

description: CS 61A: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
EE 16A: Designing Information Devices and Systems I
CS 100: Principles and Techniques of Data Science  (In Progress)

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Built an automated performance testing pipeline on the Mobile Security Team that uses sampled data for analysis to provide easily interpretable statistics and alerts incase of performance differences between product releases.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: I work with the lead developer on creating features on our product, a website that establishes a connection between growing start ups and college students interested in working at start ups.

work.title: Web Committee Director
work.description: I lead the website committee of the Berkeley branch of IEEE. As a committee, we update and develop features for our organization's website.

work.title: Undergraduate Research
work.description: I am a research assistant for Professor Williams and Professor Sudmant, assisting them in their joint research project to find a molecular basis for convergence of dormancy. In other words, we are trying to show that all the different forms of hibernations, in both mammals and insects, have a genetic basic. So far, my partner and I have developed an algorithm that efficiently finds gene mapping, given a set of species and genes. Furthermore, we've developed a formatter that converts the output, into a structure that is readily used by many genetic analysis programs, including PAML.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
